alert.note: Alert for Penobscot (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 13 at 4:06PM EDT until August 13 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: The National Weather Service in Caribou Maine has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... South central Penobscot County in east central Maine... * Until 500 PM EDT. * At 405 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Hermon, or 9 miles west of Bangor, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Bangor, Old Town, Orono, Brewer, Hampden, Hermon, Corinth, Veazie, Kenduskeag, Indian Island, Glenburn, Holden, Milford, Levant, Carmel, Eddington, Newburgh, Hudson, Bradley and Stetson. This includes the following highways... Interstate 95 between mile markers 170 and 201. State Highway 9 near Newburgh, and between Bangor and Eddington. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
